class year_month_day;
}}

The class {{tt|year_month_day}} represents a specific year, month, and day. It is a field-based time point, with a resolution of {{lc|std::chrono::days}}. {{lc|std::chrono::years}}- and {{lc|std::chrono::months}}-oriented arithmetic are supported directly. An implicit conversion to and from {{lc|std::chrono::sys_days}} allows {{lc|std::chrono::days}}-oriented arithmetic to be performed efficiently.

{{tt|year_month_day}} is a {{named req|TriviallyCopyable}} {{named req|StandardLayoutType}}.

===Example===
{{example|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    const std::chrono::time_point now{std::chrono::system_clock::now()};

    const std::chrono::year_month_day ymd{std::chrono::floor&lt;std::chrono::days&gt;(now)};

    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Current Year: " &lt;&lt; static_cast&lt;int&gt;(ymd.year()) &lt;&lt; ", "
                 "Month: " &lt;&lt; static_cast&lt;unsigned&gt;(ymd.month()) &lt;&lt; ", "
                 "Day: " &lt;&lt; static_cast&lt;unsigned&gt;(ymd.day()) &lt;&lt; "\n"
                 "ymd: " &lt;&lt; ymd &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
|output=
Current Year: 2023, Month: 9, Day: 4
ymd: 2023-09-04
}}
